channel.title: Is windows a bastard?
channel.description:
Alright, I had my portable hard drive with extremely important data on it, and apparently, windows tried to destroy my hard drive. While it was plugged in, all of a sudden, it started clicking really badly. I was freaking out and thought my hard drive under warranty has broke down! I unplugged it, then plugged it back in, and it still clicked furiously. I plug it into my PS3, listen to some music and there's no sounds coming from it.
This happens with windows XP, did it with Vista too when I had it.
Is this Microsoft's way of pissing people off, or are they hiding something.

item.title: Is windows a bastard?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Learn about the word “bastard”. Bill Gates is the father of Windows, and he’s still alive. So no, Windows isn’t a bastard.

Read full topic

item.title: Is windows a bastard?
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:5, topic:167531”]LOOOL

It clicks because the hdd disk was spinning while windows accessed it. HDDs are not silent at all.

You deleted your stuff probably by unplugging it unexpectedly. Well done rofl.[/quote]

Are you dumb, I plugged it into my PS3 and the data on it is still there, otherwise, how would I be able to listen to my music on there?

My HDD is very quiet. You have no clue what you are talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: Is windows a bastard?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

LOOOL

It clicks because the hdd disk was spinning while windows accessed it. HDDs are not silent at all.

You deleted your stuff probably by unplugging it unexpectedly. Well done rofl.
